body.p: Listed here are all the possible ways neuroConstruct can import/export data in NeuroML format

section.title: ChannelML
section.p: IMPORT: go to the Cell Mechanisms tab, press Create ChannelML Mechanism and select the file containing the ChannelML description (you can find a mapping for NEURON and GENESIS under templates/xmlTemplates/schemata/vx.x/Level2 in the local folder of NeuroConstruct).

EXPORT: go to Export Network -> NeuroML tab and press Generate all NeuroML scripts, a file for each cell mechanism is also saved in the generatedNeuroML folder of the current project (NOTE: a ChannelML file will be also saved by deafult in each folder of the cellMechanisms folder of the current project).

li.p: Level 1 = the anatomy of the cell (pure MorphML description)
IMPORT: go to Cell Types press Add new Cell Type to project... and select NeuroMLConverter in the scroll down menu.

EXPORT: go to Export Network -> NeuroML tab and press Export all Cell Types with the Level 1 button selected, a file for each cell type will be saved in the generatedNeuroML folder of the current project.
IMPORT: go to Cell Types tab press Add new Cell Type to project... and select NeuroMLConverter in the scroll down menu (NOTE: biophysics information is lost).

EXPORT: go to Export Network -> NeuroML tab and press Export all Cell Types with the Level 2 button selected, a file for each cell type will be saved in the generatedNeuroML folder of the current project.
Level 3 = Level 1, Level 2 and network aspects
IMPORT: go to Cell Types press Add new Cell Type to project... and select NeuroMLConverter in the scroll down menu (NOTE: biophysics and network informations are lost).

EXPORT: go to Export Network -> NeuroML tab and press Export all Cell Types with the Level 3 button selected, a file for each cell type will be saved in the generatedNeuroML folder of the current project.
or go to Export Network -> NeuroML tab and press Generate all NeruoML scripts, a Level 3 description of each cell type will be saved in the generatedNeuroML folder of the current project.

section.title: NetworkML
section.p: IMPORT: go to the Generate tab, press Load NetworkML and select the .xml file containing the NetworklML description
or select File -> Load NeuroML level 1, 2, 3... from the main menu and select the .xml file.
EXPORT: go to the Generate tab, press Save NetworkML, a NetworkML description of the generated network will be saved in the savedNetworks folder of the current project.
or go to Export Network -> NeuroML tab and press Generate all NeuroML scripts, a NetworkML description of the generated network will be saved in the generatedNeuroML folder of the current project.

section.title: Level 3 NeuroML
section.p: NeuroConstruct is able to generate and import a single file containing all the generated elements of a project (cells, mechanisms, inputs, connections, etc). This file is fully NeuroML compliant and allow easy exchange of self-sufficient models between neuroConstruct users.
IMPORT: select File -> Load NeuroML level 1, 2, 3... from the main menu and select the Level 3 file to be imported. (NOTE: this could overwrite some existing elements to avoid conflicts)

EXPORT: go to Export Network -> NeuroML tab and press Generate all NeuroML scripts with the Generate single NeuroML Level 3 file box ticked, a single file containing all the generated elements will be saved in the savedNetworks folder of the current project. (tick the Add neuroConstruct annotations box if you wish to include the neuroConstruct specific settings like cell groups, regions, simulation configurations etc)
